subject: Wimbledon Tennis Tournament
Tennis
lead_paragraph: The governing body of British tennis approved an agreement allowing Wimbledon organizers to buy back control of the All England Club. The agreement calls for the Lawn Tennis Association to get $83 million in installments over a five-year period. It will take effect in 2013 and last until 2053. Besides buying back half of the club they gave away in 1934, the Wimbledon organizers also will be allowed to keep 10 percent of the profits instead of giving it all to the association.
